Description: A CI/CD Lead is responsible for overseeing the implementation and management of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) processes and tools within an organization. The role involves working closely with development teams to ensure that software can be built, tested, and deployed efficiently and reliably.

Required.SkillDescription: Deep understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery processes, and the ability to implement and manage these practices for both on-premise and cloud-based applications
Hands-on experience in DevOps toolchain, including build automation, configuration management, version control, continuous integration, and deployment automation tools
Hands-on experience with public cloud infrastructure, including AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform, and ability to manage and operate infrastructure as code using tools such as Terraform
Ability to write scripts and automate tasks using languages such as Python, Ruby, and Bash
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies, and the ability to implement and manage these practices for CI/CD processes

Recommended.SkillDescription: Hands-on experience with containers and container orchestration technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
Understanding of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles and experience using tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation
Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Splunk, ELK Stack, and Prometheus
Understanding of security best practices and experience implementing security controls for CI/CD processes and tools
Experience in release management, and the ability to manage and coordinate releases across multiple environments and teams
Ability to collaborate effectively with development, testing, and operations teams, and to facilitate effective communication and knowledge sharing
Ability to drive continuous improvement for CI/CD processes and tools, and to identify opportunities for optimization and efficiency gains
Ability to manage vendor relationships and to evaluate and select vendor solutions that meet the needs of the organization
Understanding of project management principles, and the ability to manage CI/CD projects and programs
Ability to manage and lead teams of developers, engineers, and other technical personnel
Strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Ability to provide leadership and mentorship to team members, and to create a culture of innovation and continuous improvement
Ability to develop and execute strategic plans for CI/CD processes and tools, and to align these plans with the goals and objectives of the organization
